question: Match List-I with List-II:

| List-I (Types of redox reactions) | List-II (Examples) |
|---|---|
| a. Combination reaction | i. <katex>$\text{Cl}_{2(g)} + 2\text{Br}^-_{(aq)} \rightarrow 2\text{Cl}^-_{(aq)} + \text{Br}_{2(l)}$</katex> |
| b. Decomposition reaction | ii. <katex>$2\text{H}_2\text{O}_{2(aq)} \rightarrow 2\text{H}_2\text{O}_{(l)} + \text{O}_{2(g)}$</katex> |
| c. Displacement reaction | iii. <katex>$\text{CH}_{4(g)} + 2\text{O}_{2(g)} \rightarrow \text{CO}_{2(g)} + 2\text{H}_2\text{O}_{(l)}$</katex> |
| d. Disproportionation reaction | iv. <katex>$2\text{H}_2\text{O}_{(l)} \rightarrow 2\text{H}_{2(g)} + \text{O}_{2(g)}$</katex> |
explanation: Combination reaction: <katex>$\text{CH}_{4(g)} + 2\text{O}_{2(g)} \rightarrow \text{CO}_{2(g)} + 2\text{H}_2\text{O}_{(l)}$</katex> (Combustion is a type of combination in broad terms, though strictly oxidation. Here it matches best by elimination or typo in source question). *Correction based on standard classification*: The provided solution maps 'a' to 'iii'.
